title: Pick of Devon's produce can be sampled at Buckfast Abbey food fair | Devon Live
text:
Pick of Devon's produce can be sampled at Buckfast Abbey food fair By RomPEllis | Posted: July 10, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Pick of Devon's produce can be sampled at Buckfast Abbey food fair X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Some of Devon's best produce will be showcased in a summer food fair in the gardens of one of the county's best known religious venues. 
Local artisans and regional food producers will descend on Buckfast Abbey on Saturday for its first Summer Food Fair in celebration of the county's best offerings. 
A whole host of produce will be available including jams, chutneys, curds, chilli salts, macaroons, fudge, ales and coffee. Guests will enjoy coffee demonstrations throughout the day, food tasting at stalls and children will be able to decorate their own cupcakes in the kid's zone. 
The food fair will be spread across a marquee food hall on the lawn with stalls outside and at The Grange Restaurant's covered terrace, where a variety of refreshments will be available such as Hunters Brewery Ales from Ipplepen, Creber's Rock Cider of South Brent, Riverford Farmshop and mocktails from Newton Abbot's Cocktail Kings.

A spokesperson for Buckfast Abbey said: "Devon is well-known for its artisan culture but it is also a great place to forage. For those interested in learning more about this, local foraging expert David Beazley will be on hand to offer tips and will also have a variety of vintage cookbooks available to purchase. 
Buckfast Abbey will be hosting two stalls, the first with vegetable and herb plants where visitors will be able to pick-up some gardening tips from the abbey's expert gardening team. The second stall will be offering monastic food and drink made by monasteries from around Europe. 
The Buckfast Abbey Summer Food Fair takes place on Saturday between 10am and 4pm. Entry is free, with ample free parking available on site.
